channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: They split the ticket. Meet the abortion rights voters who also went for Trump
item.description: Data from a large survey of U.S. voters found that a significant subset of voters who supported abortion rights ballot measures also voted for Trump.
item.content:encoded:
Data from a large survey of U.S. voters found that a significant subset of voters who supported abortion rights ballot measures also voted for Trump.

(Image credit: Matt York)
item.dc:creator: Sarah Varney

item.title: The transition to the Trump administration is underway. But it’s already behind
item.description: The presidential election is over, and the complicated two-month sprint has begun to hand over the levers of power from one administration to the next.
item.content:encoded:
The presidential election is over, and the complicated two-month sprint has begun to hand over the levers of power from one administration to the next.

(Image credit: Chip Somodevilla)
item.dc:creator: Tamara Keith

item.title: New DNA evidence upends what we thought we knew about Pompeii victims
item.description: The findings, which used DNA from the plaster casts of people who died in the Mt. Vesuvius eruption two millennia ago, challenge the traditional gender and familial assumptions about the Pompeiians.
item.content:encoded:
The findings, which used DNA from the plaster casts of people who died in the Mt. Vesuvius eruption two millennia ago, challenge the traditional gender and familial assumptions about the Pompeiians.

(Image credit: Lefteris Pitarakis)
item.dc:creator: Emma Bowman

item.title: From Taiwan to technology, China ponders what's to come under Trump 2.0
item.description: Chinese business people may be able to find creative ways to avoid U.S. tariffs, but for Beijing, its concerns for the incoming Trump presidency go beyond trade.
item.content:encoded:
Chinese business people may be able to find creative ways to avoid U.S. tariffs, but for Beijing, its concerns for the incoming Trump presidency go beyond trade.

(Image credit: Frederic J. Brown)
item.dc:creator: John Ruwitch

item.title: Mail ballot challenges are dropped in Pennsylvania shortly after Election Day
item.description: Within two days after Election Day, right-wing activists and two Republican state lawmakers in Pennsylvania withdrew thousands of last-minute challenges to voters’ absentee ballot applications.
item.content:encoded:
Within two days after Election Day, right-wing activists and two Republican state lawmakers in Pennsylvania withdrew thousands of last-minute challenges to voters’ absentee ballot applications.

(Image credit: Hannah Beier)
item.dc:creator: Hansi Lo Wang

item.title: 2020’s debunked election fraud claims are coming back due to Trump’s 2024 victory
item.description: Election deniers have spent the past four years focused on false claims that 2020 was rigged. This year, it raised similar alarms about fraud — only for those claims to evaporate as returns came in.
item.content:encoded:
Election deniers have spent the past four years focused on false claims that 2020 was rigged. This year, it raised similar alarms about fraud — only for those claims to evaporate as returns came in.

(Image credit: Ed Jones)
item.dc:creator: Shannon Bond

item.title: Why it’s so hard for parents to let their kid quit
item.description: Piano lessons and soccer practice can encourage grit. But if your kid isn’t into it, it can become a stress-inducing obligation. Here’s how to have hard conversations with your child about quitting.
item.content:encoded: Piano lessons and soccer practice can encourage grit. But if your kid isn’t into it, it can become a stress-inducing obligation. Here’s how to have hard conversations with your child about quitting.
item.dc:creator: Becky Harlan

item.title: Death toll rises to 24 in suicide bombing at a rail station in southwestern Pakistan
item.description: The bomb exploded when nearly 100 passengers were waiting for a train to travel to the city of Rawalpindi from Quetta, the capital of the restive Balochistan province, said a senior police officer.
item.content:encoded:
The bomb exploded when nearly 100 passengers were waiting for a train to travel to the city of Rawalpindi from Quetta, the capital of the restive Balochistan province, said a senior police officer.

(Image credit: Arshad Butt)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Judge cancels court deadlines in Trump's 2020 election case after presidential win
item.description: The judge overseeing Trump's 2020 election interference case canceled remaining court deadlines as prosecutors assess the “the appropriate course going forward” in light of the presidential victory.
item.content:encoded:
The judge overseeing Trump's 2020 election interference case canceled remaining court deadlines as prosecutors assess the “the appropriate course going forward” in light of the presidential victory.

(Image credit: Alex Brandon)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Southern California firefighters gain ground over wildfire thanks to decreased winds
item.description: Firefighters gained ground Friday against a wildfire that has destroyed at least 132 structures, as favorable conditions were expected to continue through the weekend after two days of gusty winds.
item.content:encoded:
Firefighters gained ground Friday against a wildfire that has destroyed at least 132 structures, as favorable conditions were expected to continue through the weekend after two days of gusty winds.

(Image credit: Jae C. Hong)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
